issue.title: is_(nothrow_)move_constructible and tuple, optional and unique_ptr

discussion.p: The move constructors for tuple, optional, and unique_ptr should return false for is_(nothrow_)move_constructible_v<TYPE> when their corresponding Requires clauses are not satisfied, as there are now several library clauses that are defined in terms of these traits. The same concern applies to the move-assignment operator. Note that pair and variant already satisfy this constraint.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4640.

blockquote.pre: template <class... UTypes> EXPLICIT constexpr tuple(UTypes&&... u) noexcept(see below);

blockquote.p:
-8- Effects: Initializes the elements in the tuple with the corresponding value in std::forward<UTypes>(u).
-9- Remarks: This constructor shall not participate in overload resolution unless sizeof...(Types) == sizeof...(UTypes) and sizeof...(Types) >= 1 and is_constructible_v<Ti, Ui&&> is true for all i. The constructor is explicit if and only if is_convertible_v<Ui&&, Ti> is false for at least one i. The expression inside noexcept is equivalent to the logical AND of the following expressions:

p.ins: where Ti is the ith type in Types, and Ui is the ith type in UTypes.
